There are two events related to gazebo shutting down, marked with the same comment

      /// \brief Simulation stop signal
      public: static EventT<void ()> stop;

      /// \brief Simulation stop signal
      public: static EventT<void ()> sigInt;

AFAIK, the stop event is never triggered in the code (there is one listener to the event gazebo/transport/ConnectionManager.cc).

Additionally, in the GUI, neither event is called (even though GUI does have a sigint handler). Currently I am writing a plugin where it would be useful to be notified of a shutdown/sigint. I suspect other developers would connect to sigInt from the GUI expecting it to be triggered.

I propose both server and client should trigger stop when stopped (including due to a sigint) and sigInt when a SIGINT/SIGTERM signal is received.
